title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 113.23 - Final determination
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 113.23 - Final determination

State Regulations
(a) If
no panel was designated to consider an appeal pursuant to section
113.19
of this Part, the city board
shall finally determine the appeal by filing an order either affirming the
order of the chancellor from which the appeal was taken or modifying or
reversing such order if it is determined to be arbitrary or capricious, or
contrary to law, regulation or sound educational policy. Such order shall be
filed not later than the 30th day following the date of filing of the last
filed appeal paper. The order shall state or be accompanied by a memorandum
stating the grounds on which the order is based. (b) If a panel was designated to consider an
appeal, the panel shall upon its determination of the appeal, file with the
city board, not later than 25 days after the filing of the last filed appeal
paper, the written record of the appeal and a proposed order either affirming
the order of the chancellor from which the appeal was taken or modifying or
reversing such order if it is determined to be arbitrary or capricious, or
contrary to law, regulation or sound educational policy. The proposed order
shall state or be accompanied by a memorandum stating the grounds on which the
proposed order is based. The city board shall then finally determine the appeal
in accordance with subdivision (a) of this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
113.23

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
